plants.name: Prunus serrulata
plants.description: A deciduous tree famous for its spectacular spring display of pale pink to white flowers, often blooming before the leaves emerge. These blossoms are central to traditional cherry blossom festivals and symbolize the transient nature of life in Japanese culture.
plants.location: Temperate regions of Japan, Korea, China, and also cultivated in temperate regions worldwide
plants.funFact: The Japanese cherry blossom trees have over 200 different cultivars, each with distinct flower shapes and blooming times.

plants.name: Narcissus pseudonarcissus
plants.description: A perennial bulbous plant producing fragrant, trumpet-shaped yellow flowers in early spring. Wild daffodils are native to woodlands and meadows, often forming natural carpets of bright yellow during blooming season.
plants.location: Western Europe, particularly the UK and France
plants.funFact: Wild daffodils are toxic if ingested and have been used historically as insect repellents.

plants.name: Magnolia Ã— soulangeana
plants.description: A hybrid magnolia tree with large, tulip-shaped flowers that appear on bare branches before leafing out. Its blooms range in color from white to deep pink and can emit a sweet fragrance.
plants.location: Cultivated widely in temperate regions, native hybrid originally from China
plants.funFact: Saucer magnolia is one of the first trees to bloom in early spring, making it an important nectar source for early pollinators.

plants.name: Banksia integrifolia
plants.description: An evergreen tree native to eastern Australia with cylindrical flower spikes composed of many small flowers, ranging from creamy yellow to orange. It blooms through autumn, winter and into spring, including April, providing important food for native birds and mammals.
plants.bloomingSeason: Autumn to Spring (March to May included)
plants.funFact: Banksias have woody cones that open after exposure to fire, adapted to survive in fire-prone environments.
